class.name: ArtNetController
class.brief_description: ArtNet controller for sending DMX data over Art-Net protocol.
class.description:
ArtNetController provides a GDScript interface to the lib-artnet-4-cpp library, enabling ArtNet DMX transmission from Godot. This class wraps the Art-Net 4 protocol implementation and allows you to configure network settings, set DMX channel data, and send ArtNet packets.
Art-Net is a protocol for transmitting DMX512 data over Ethernet networks, commonly used in professional lighting control systems.

method.name: configure
method.description:
Configures the ArtNet controller with network and universe settings. - [param bind_address]: The local IP address to bind to (use "0.0.0.0" to bind to all interfaces) - [param port]: The UDP port to use (default Art-Net port is 6454) - [param net]: The Art-Net net value (0-127) - [param subnet]: The Art-Net subnet value (0-15) - [param universe]: The Art-Net universe value (0-15) - [param broadcast_address]: The broadcast address to send packets to (default: "255.255.255.255")
Returns [code]true[/code] if configuration was successful, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: start
method.description: Starts the ArtNet controller and begins network operations. Returns [code]true[/code] if started successfully, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the ArtNet controller and stops all network operations.

method.name: is_running
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the controller is currently running, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: set_dmx_data
method.description:
Sets the DMX data for a specific universe. The data array should contain up to 512 channel values (0-255). - [param universe]: The universe number to set data for - [param data]: A PackedByteArray containing DMX channel values (0-255)
Returns [code]true[/code] if the data was set successfully, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: send_dmx
method.description: Sends the configured DMX data as an ArtNet packet. Returns [code]true[/code] if the packet was sent successfully, [code]false[/code] otherwise.
